3: The Babylonia members and the Ascendants have both arrived near the Observatory. Dispatching guards now...
Send guards to clean out the Corrupted before they damage the relics.
That course of action will lower our chances of victory.
Those relics are a precious part of Kowloong. Go and give the orders, Huaxu.
Understood.
If they want to climb up here to the Observatory, let them.
In this very yard...
I will destroy them all.
...This leads up to the Observatory.
After a long trek, Gabriel finally arrives at the base of the Observatory. Here inside the light wall, free of the flames of war, Gabriel is almost like a theater actor waiting for the audience.
The Corrupted I've brought should create enough of a diversion. This tower should hold what I seek.
The Gestalt-like creation must be inside, but the tower will certainly be littered with traps.
Direct confrontation does not concern Gabriel, but unforeseen circumstances—the prospect of disappointing Luna—does.
And so, he hides.
Commandant, we're not far from the tower's base now.
No guards... Are they welcoming us in?
More like a display of arrogance.
Stop right there, invaders!
Still tailing us, huh... Commandant, if we go in like this, we'll get sandwiched!

4: Gotta get in the tower now.

3: We've left most of them behind already. Now let's take care of the rest here!
Can't afford to get stalled... I think I just caught a glimpse of Gabriel.
Okay, I'll be the decoy, Lee and Liv can get rid of them.
